_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2013 14:48:04 using v0.9
title: Do mortality rates for people with serious mental health illness differ to the population?
analysis_commentary: The difference in mortality rates between the general population and people under 75 years with serious mental illness is large; being over three times as high as the rest of the population. There has been little progress to reduce this gap over the time period measured.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Outcomes Framework indicator portal
